website_summaries.verdict: The Energy Take Classic 5.1 is the best budget speaker system we've reviewed, earning our Editors' Choice Award with its outstanding sound quality and exquisite looks.
pros: The Energy Take Classic 5.1 offers outstanding sound quality for a compact surround-sound speaker system
All of the speakers feature a beautiful piano-black finish, looking more expensive than the system's budget price
Altogether, the system is one of the best home theater values available
cons: Pioneer's SP-PK21BS sounds better for the same price, although it's a much larger system

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong after 5 years
customer_reviews.text: I have had this system in my living room for 5 years now, and am still happy with the sound quality. 4 stars is only because I have never owned a "audiophile" quality/priced system, so I have nothing to compare it with. However, I am in the live entertainment business and have heard many large theatre and arena sound systems, so I feel I'm somewhat qualified to make informed/experienced comments.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I've had this surround system for several years now and I'm still impressed with the sound quality for the money spent. I even recommended it to my dad and he loves his too. It seems to manage all the channels in a very balanced way, which is of course more to do with the AV receiver amp, my older Denon. The sub-woofer is just the right amount of bass and all channels come through clean and clear. Dialogue comes through really well. I like the small speaker size but wish they came with a choice of finishes other than just lacquer black. Music sounds pretty good too.
customer_reviews.author: S L.

customer_reviews.title: If you live in an apartment and love surround sound but don't want to pay a ton ...
customer_reviews.text: If you live in an apartment and love surround sound but don't want to pay a ton of money for something that will sound great this is your best bet. The speakers work beautiful and produce a sound that's incredibly clear and detailed. Similar to what you'd find in extremely expensive speakers but for way less. The only fault this product has is if you plan to put this in a big open space it won't work as well. These guys work great in a smaller space like an apartment or condo, but if you plan to use this in your 1,400 sq ft living room the sound is going to get lost no matter what you do.
customer_reviews.author: SashaSasha

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound
customer_reviews.text: The sound out of this system is amazing for the size and price of it. Setup was very quick and simple. My only complaint is that the satellite speakers would not mount right side up on the set of stands i bought due to the location from which the cable wires attach to speakers. Had to mount them upside down. barely noticeable unless you are looking directly at them. Connected through a Yamaha RX-v483 receiver and the bass sound very clear yet not overwhelming. Satellite speakers break out the sounds very well. No need to crank the volume to get loud, a small increase makes a huge sound. very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: dmckee

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional sound but one easily remedied problem.
customer_reviews.text: I combined these speakers with an Onkyo TX-NR646. The sound is stellar and more than loud enough for 20x20 room. I would have given these 5 stars but about a month after I installed them I received a "Speaker Wire" error code on the Onkyo. I tracked this down and it was some looseness in an internal connector of the right front speaker. This was remedied by taking the speaker apart and moving one wire. Since this repair they have worked flawlessly. The sound is truly exceptional for a set of speakers for this price. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tigerjp

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical I would be happy with a $300 speaker set even with a list price of $600. Combine these with a good receiver that will let you send all the bass to the subwoofer and you will be very happy. I use a Pioneer VSX-531. Just buy them. You can just return them if you don't like them. I doubt anyone except serious audiophiles with unlimited budgets will return them.
customer_reviews.author: John L. Mills

customer_reviews.title: Like 'em alot
customer_reviews.text: Wicked good set of speakers. I'm no audiophile or anything but I do know I got a great deal buying these. Very good quality, I mean really good. Solid,Heavy construction, great sound, wicked bass.....except for that danged bright blue light .... guys you gotta install an on/off switch for that thing .... I wasn't expecting this kind of quality. I think we're seeing the next Sony or Samsung type manufacturer here. Remember when we thought those were crap when they were new?? These are not entry level by any scale even though the price seems to indicate it,...... what a great value. My whole room shakes watching a Rambo type movie ... wicked cool.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Finally did it after 6 yrs of waiting.
customer_reviews.text: I have been watching this system for 6 yrs. I went away then came back. Always the reviews shone and the price was approachable. Finally decided to order and get it over with. Just set it up 1 hr ago and it is night and day from my previous speakers, and they were no slouch, just tired. If my ears were eyes, I just got a new Rx and now 'see' what I have been missing. They arent even broken in yet! Now, I have 6 yrs of movies and music to rewatch/listen. I highly recommend and concur with all the glowing reviews. Best bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: John Mullen

customer_reviews.title: Decent value for the money - great sound
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bundle in late 2016. Sound quality is excellent....especially for the $. A few of the speakers started to produce underlying static. I contacted Klipsch and they quickly sent me replacement speakers....no issue, no hassle. I would recommend this product. You can see from the picture I purchased ceiling mounts...not the most attractive but the surround sound directly aimed at the couch is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: M. Vorel

customer_reviews.title: 1 Year Review
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for our home entertainment center in the main living room. These setup quickly and sounded great. 1 Year later after running these only through cable TV for sound, both the left an right fronts are completely blown. The max I've ever turned these up was 70% off of a Yamaha receiver at 55W per channel. We have no kids to monkey with the system, so I know only my wife and I control the volume levels. Durability is disappointing. Keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Cham Pain

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I never expected these little speakers to perform greatly, boy was I wrong! I feel that these were my single best purchase ever. I have a bit of a audiophile taste in speakers and these speakers have out performed my expectations. They fill my large living room with plenty of bass and across the spectrum of sound. Midrange is clear and the highs are impactful. Love these speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Be patient
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are awesome. One tip: be a little patient. Initially, after stringing speaker wire and hooking them up, one of them sounded terrible, as if it had been ruined in shipping or improperly made in the factory. It sounded buzzy, like a major piece was loose. I intended to ship it back, but I did not have time, so I just left it in place. After a few days, (using the speakers lightly, but using them despite the problems) the buzzing disappeared completely, and now all of the speakers sound great!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Brodie

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: We have owned this home theater system for about one year now and it continues to impress us. The price is outstanding and so is the equipment. We paired this speaker system with an Onkyo receiver and are very pleased with the results. For the price you will not find any other products that can compete with this surround sound speaker system. Do your own research these speakers are rated highly in many different places for good reason!
customer_reviews.author: Breanna

customer_reviews.title: really good value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and paired it up with an Onkyo TX-NR686. Both seemed to be the best value buy that I could find. There's better equipment out there, for double the price for somewhat better performance. I got really good sound at a really reasonable price, I'm really happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Skeptical Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Poor build quality
customer_reviews.text: They sound good for the price and look fantastic, but the dust caps/domes in the center of them have fallen off 3 of the speakers one by one after 8 months of ownership. I had to superglue them back on. I'm betting many people don't notice this with the speaker grills on and have lost theirs as well. It doesn't bode well for the build quality, and if I wanted bad build quality I would have just gone for the much cheaper monoprice. They are also difficult to find affordable speaker stands that fit with their strange mount design, and are finger print and dust magnets.
customer_reviews.author: R. Britton

customer_reviews.title: Great mid-level setup for smaller areas
customer_reviews.text: Just the right sound I was looking for.. I have a small area for my home theater and these fill the area with great sound without being too powerful or too soft. The base is just right for the area.. while it's not a supper low rumble base it's great for the size area and still rattles the bathroom windows. The speakers have a very clear undistorted sound that sound great in a small setup. Yes, you can get a much better and fuller sounding speaker system that will crack you windows and vibrate cats off the fence 3 houses down, but not at this price. It's a great mid-level setup.
customer_reviews.author: David H

customer_reviews.title: Buy these, Energy Take 5
customer_reviews.text: Excellent speaker set. It is Klipsch at a better price. I don't care for the glossy piano black but the sound makes up for the extra dusting needed. I wanted speakers that would work for both TV and also act as my main audio output. I play music alot (old school and new). These speakers sound terrific paired with my Onkyo receiver. It was a learning curve to determine best listening mode for TV but once I figured out my receiver settings, these speakers really shined. Get these unless you have a ton of money to spend, they are way better than Bose for mids and highs.
customer_reviews.author: Indigo

customer_reviews.title: Just out of warranty the center speaker broke :-(
customer_reviews.text: I've had these speakers for a year and have been amazed out how great they were for the price. Movies sprang to life, music sounded great, I couldn't have been happier. Until tonight when the center speaker started rattling! I took off the cover and saw that the center portion of the speaker and separated, it's what was rattling around. See attached picture. I haven't abused these speakers and I don't listen to things "loud". Of course this happened a month out of warranty and there is nothing to be done. Having read some of the other reviews concerning quality control I'm wondering what will break next...
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: great sound!!
customer_reviews.text: What a difference from a samsung HT that I had. They also look great! You do have to make sure all the settings are correctly set to enjoy them. Set the levels manually, the mic and automatic calibration feature doesn't work well.... the settings were all over the place. I felt like the speakers worked well right away but the sub woofer needed to be broken in. It got better and stronger as time went by.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: Great system!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son and his wife for Christmas. Almost never got that big heavy box gift-wrapped and in the car!! It was like wrestling a rhino! It has great sound, and is worth the price. Loud, clear, realistic sound! Really makes you feel like you're there in the action if you put the speakers in front and behind. Sounds like a movie theater when he cranks it up! They live in a duplex, and I'll bet when he kicks it in high gear, the neighbors are sitting on the couch with their butts and feet vibrating! LOL! They are very happy with it, therefore, I am, too. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: connie w.

customer_reviews.title: A lot of bang for the buck...
customer_reviews.text: Just like the reviews show, these are very good speakers for the price. I have 3 sets in 2 configurations as 7.1 on a "Onkyo TX-NR636" and 7.2 on a "Sony STR-DN1050". They are sitting on some cheap stands "Atlantic Satellite 77305018 2 Speaker Stands", which are okay. I used "C&E CNE62270 100-Feet 12AWG Enhanced Loud Oxygen-Free Copper Speaker Wire Cable" for the wiring with "Deadbolt Banana Plugs, 12-pair, By Sewell Direct". These plugs work really well with the speaker wire. All in all, not bad to two full complete setups. Could have paid tons more for a lot less...
customer_reviews.author: TAR

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat the performance:price ratio
customer_reviews.text: Not well packed and had to replace the entire set just to replace one damage upon arrival speaker. Even with that great inconvenience, these speakers are an amazing value for the price. I've never been able to max these out and never get distortion. Believe buyer reviews, theae are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: shanerc

customer_reviews.title: I can hear you now.
customer_reviews.text: Basic. In looks only. And that's just the black side. The materials here are superb. The simplicity just speaks to what's really important, the sound. These are amazing. The mounts on the rear are great for multiple types of mounts. I purchased the recommended set of 5 and they're great. You may need to unscrew the screw hang mount on the rear to get these mounts to hold on to the speaker themselves, but that's no issue. Super happy with this set of speakers.
customer_reviews.author: B. A.

customer_reviews.title: I'm loving my choice!
customer_reviews.text: I chose these over Bose and I don't regret my decision at all. I love the small size but don't let that fool you, the sound quality is amazing. If you are looking for Home Theater speakers, these will be very hard to beat. These speakers even make your CD's and MP3's sound great! The sub woofer is wonderful. It has adjustments for crossover point, phase and volume level. you can attach regular speaker wires or RCA cables depending on what your receiver offers. I'm loving my choice.
customer_reviews.author: RLC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product. Sound is great
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Sound is great. Very clear and crisp. Bass is also very good. After the "break in" period, I cranked the volume and they make the house shake. I read A LOT of reviews (cnet etc) before purchasing a sound system. This was recommend as entry level or for a low price window. By far, well worth it. They do not sound like entry level or "budget" speakers. I have been around a lot of bose products and I would say that if you use these for movies and video games you wouldn't be able to tell the difference. Having a good receiver is also very important.
customer_reviews.author: amazonajay

customer_reviews.title: These speakers step up to the plate with small size and great sound.
customer_reviews.text: Pairs sweetly with my DN850 Receiver. I have no complaints with this system. The sound is crisp and clear. For the price, this set is hard to beat. The speakers are small, but powerful, and the sub allows for easy customization and great bass. I love music, but do not consider myself an audiophile. I've got Bose headphones...and while Bose speakers would be awesome, these speakers step up to the plate with small size and great sound. The sub (on auto power) does sometimes power off if the volume is turned down, but not muted. I don't find this inconvenient since, if the volume is low, I'm probably trying to be quiet.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had the money for two sets!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a surround sound system for our TV, but we hooked it up in our bedroom first to test it out while our TV room was being renovated. Now I don't want to move it! I personally can't tell the difference in quality from this and the $2000 system that was also recommended to us, but I also can't claim to be a specialist in this area. I can just tell you that the sound easily fills up our large master bedroom (about the same size as our TV room actually) with crystal clear sound and the perfect amount of bass.
customer_reviews.author: McKinnonFamily

customer_reviews.title: These sound great. I've had them for over a year
customer_reviews.text: These sound great. I've had them for over a year, and I love them. They stil look great. After I balance them, I turn up the middle channel a little higher so I can hear dialogue better with my old ears. (I gave my soul to Jesus, but my ears to rock and roll.)
customer_reviews.author: Dr Davy

customer_reviews.title: shakes my loveseat!
customer_reviews.text: Almost done creating a home theater in my living room. Haven't officially hung the speakers in their final spots but after hanging myprojector I just had to watch a movie. Watched "Super 8" streaming from my AppleTV and couldn't believe the sound coming from these little speakers. During the train wreck scene my loveseat was shaking like I was there, even though the subwoofer is 11 feet away firing into a carpeted floor. Plus in other scenes I could hear position-specific scene details in the various other speakers. Very happy already and they're barely broken in. BTW- using thereceiver to distribute the audio.
customer_reviews.author: Melania Trumpskya

customer_reviews.title: The speakers have a good sound quality for TV and movie viewing
customer_reviews.text: Very satisified. The speakers have a good sound quality for TV and movie viewing. The center speaker is very clear and I have no trouble understanding spoken dialogue - much better than the TV speakers. I haven't used the speakers much for music as I use my tower speakers connected to Zone 2 in my Yamaha receiver. I would give it 5 stars but I feel the bass could be a bit deeper for a more dynamic sound. Overall a great budget speaker system - glad I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant, rich sound at an economic sweet spot.
customer_reviews.text: A noticeable improvement over my previous all-in-one system's speakers. I bought these on the basis of ubiquitous rave reviews all over the net, during the holiday seasons when they cost $300 — a huge value. My Denon runs 100w/channel and so far, following both manufacturer's recommendations, I'm holding at 70% maximum volume (fine for movies; I'd like more for concerts but they recommend a long break in period). I can't compare to other products so this review is a bit disadvantaged but their sound is richer, much better on the low end and more expansive throughout the kids and uppers. It's a pleasant sonic feel.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Windrum

customer_reviews.title: Great sound out of a little package!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Excellent price. They put out some decent "Energy" for small speakers. Larger speakers of course would be better, but if you have the requirement for small speakers (my front three are mounted above my projector screen, which is above my bay window), then these will surely do nice. The price is great as well. Too bad they are discontinued, as they are still quite a bit better than a lot of HTiB stuff. If they could re-package these with an inexpensive receiver, you got a great starter system.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Q.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and price
customer_reviews.text: I can see why so positive reviews. Great finish all around. For the money you can't find a better product. My setup is about a room with high ceilings and about 100 sq feet living room and they sound great. Using it with a Denon AVR-S900W receiver and great sound. I think having a good receiver helps. A good tip: I mount them with this speaker mount : Monoprice Product ID: 8284 (Amazon removed the link) look them up in google the website.The other mounts in these reviews were to out from the wall for my taste. I wanted a flush mount but these speakers you can't flush mount them.
customer_reviews.author: Armin Cardenas

customer_reviews.title: Sub is defective after 9/10 months.
customer_reviews.text: The sub died after 9 months. What a waste of money. No customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Wilson

customer_reviews.title: The speakers look great and sound OK
customer_reviews.text: 5 days after purchase. The speakers look great and sound OK. keep in mind that most receivers have one rca output, and the subwoofer has a dual rca input (red/white) so i had to buy a rca "Y" split cable, and also a rca red/white cable. the speakers look nice, glossy black finish as advertised and sound ok until now, still they need to break in. One big disappointment is that the subwoofer's dustcap came bended, its is very hard to fix. I contacted Amazon immediately but its has been 5 days and had no answer so far. make sure you buy good wire, 16 awg with polarity,
customer_reviews.author: arianna

customer_reviews.title: You will not be disappointed with these!
customer_reviews.text: So you're looking for a surround sound setup.......stop shopping and buy this now! I spent a lot of time shopping for a 5.1 setup and kept coming back to these. I was hesitant because these were an older model of speaker, but holy s*^t these are amazing! I read the reviews like you are now so I gave them a shot. After calibration setup I was blown away with the quality! They look pretty, they sound pretty, these speakers are the bees knees! Used as surround sound speakers and for casually listening to music, both experiences are brilliant. Do yourself a favor and try these on for size, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: jdgriffin

customer_reviews.title: This system is better than my old combo Boston acoustics/Polk system so I ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this system over a year and I have never once had an issue or a complaint. This system is better than my old combo Boston acoustics/Polk system so I use it as my main system. I would buy this again for sure, it was one of my favorite purchases. 10/10. I did a LOOOOOT of research. Return it if you don't like it and don't believe me.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Evergy 5.1 Take Classic Home Theater System speakers
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh - AMAZING!! I was skeptical which unpacked the box and saw how small (I'm still in the 70's decade when bigger was better) but the sound quality is awesome!! And subwoofer - really packs a punch. While hooking everything up, I was sitting in front of subwoofer when my husband turned up the volume. Felt like someone brushed my arm and flipped my hair!! He really has the downstairs "rumbling" and loving watching TV again!!
customer_reviews.author: C. Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recomend this!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great 5.1 system. It was a real upgrade from my last one. I assure you that for this dollar amount, it is by far one of the best speaker system that you can buy today. You have to be extremely into sound or rich to think that you need something better. I noticed that lots of people who review this speaker systems are very picky and tend to favor higher end speakers and higher price tags. I can't say they aren't right, but for the vast majority of us this system provides more than we can appreciate. It gives very good sound quality at good price level! I truly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Skyeboy

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Replaced an Atlantic 5.1 speaker system with this Energy speaker system. Primary reason for the replacement was the constant humming of the Atlantic subwoofer. I researched and found that this is a common problem. Tried everything recommended to do - nothing worked. The energy system has three settings on the subwoofer: on - auto - off. Just like many cars have for the headlights. I put it on "auto" no humming and the overall sound is a lot better too. I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: upeter911

customer_reviews.title: Small Speakers with a Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: This set of speakers really sounds well and looks good. You cannot go wrong with it. It has a rich and clear sound comparable to more expensive equipment. Just connect it to a nice mid-price receiver like a Yamaha rx-v479 or 579. Don't spend more unless you have ears to fine tune a piano or want the best of the best. For the price, there are no better options out there according to well known reviews and I agree. The manual recommends a 50 hours break in period at moderate volume. Do not rush to test the speakers' limits, manufacturer knows best.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cereceda

customer_reviews.title: Great product that sounds fantastic - do not hesitate buying it.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sound for the price.Very clear and crisp sound and sub has plenty of power to provide the base you are looking for. I have this system in a smaller room (12 x 14) so in a larger room it may not perform as well but I am very impressed with the sound quality. It does take some power to run the speakers so makes sure your amplifier has enough power to drive them. It says 20 watts minimum but I doubt that would be enough. I have a Yamaha receiver with 110 watts per channel and there is more than enough power.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Johnson

customer_reviews.title: More than you need, all that you want
customer_reviews.text: This is theater quality. Only the old school Logitech powerhouse compares to this set in an off the shelf package. If you have the change for this set at this price point its pretty hard to beat. If you have more than enough money, then go ahead and look at Klipsch. For everyone else, stop looking, buy this set then save up for a nice head unit like the Sony-STRDN1060 Receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Stapp

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars +
customer_reviews.text: WOW!!! Just received this system and hooked it up to a Yamaha Receiver. I know it will take some time to break in but for now the music still sounds crisp, clean and clear. Can't wait for the 50hrs to elapse. Just listened to Copland's Fanfare for the Common Man and the sound blew me away. Can just imagine how much better they will get overtime and when I finally get to remove the fronts from the wall so they can breathe properly. Anyone still not yet convinced just need to get these speakers and run them through the paces. I'M NOW A BELIEVER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Calvin

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace some 18yr old sony ss-v325 and I am very happy how they fill my living room with sound during movies. I'm not a audiophile so my expectations are clear and full sounds which I get with these. Are there better speakers out there for more money I'm sure there are but for $250 you won't be to upset
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this bundle is a great set up for my duplex style suite
customer_reviews.text: Slightly quieter than I expected, this bundle is a great set up for my duplex style suite. I have no regrets buying these though I do have 2 supplemental speakers and a great receiver that really maximize their worth! The shiny sleek blackness of them are excellent, but youll need to make sure you have either stands or a tabletop to put them on! Their quality is not up to par off the floor. No speakers are necessarily but these especially. All in all i love them and breaking them in has been a thrill. MB
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Amazing speakers at budget price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound, beautiful speakers. Small and compact in size, but not in sound. Rich, full sound especially after initial 2-3 days of use. The sub hits like a Mack truck. Put the satellites up on a pair of Sanus Tear drop stands. The sound alone makes these 100% great, but the extra touches are just a bonus. The sleek piano black looks beautiful but also very reserved if you don't feel like flashy speakers. Speaker wires can attach either by standard twist lock or Banana clips if you prefer easily. I couldn't be happier with this set.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing speakers
customer_reviews.text: Like all other reviewers mention it before, these little speakers are amazing! Can they equal the big boxy speakers you'll find in the "magnolia room", probably not. But in my 30 X 20 movie room they sound amazing! I hook them up to a Pioneer vsx-1123k, 60" Panasonic plasma v series and the sound its outstanding. It took me about 100 hours of moderate use before I could squeeze the best sound out of them. I also had to play around with the subwoofer to get the correct "boom" but now, I can say this is probably the best sound you could get for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: There boxes have been excellent for years and continue to be so
customer_reviews.text: There boxes have been excellent for years and continue to be so. Have been using them this past month in a smaller listening room (13' x 12'). Excellent movie audio, music audio and TV results. Subwoofer completes the package as one might expect. Excellent system for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Ohiochase

customer_reviews.title: Met expectations
customer_reviews.text: I bought these speakers after reading previous reviews. I was fearful that I might go into this purchase with too high of expectations. Fortunately, I was not disappointed as the speakers were of good quality both in workmanship and sound quality. I connected these to my Pioneer VSX-1120-K 7.1-Channel Home Theater system that I bought at the same time and they're a pretty good match. All of this said, please do manage your expectations. These are excellent speakers for a small to medium size room and for normal listening. If you're an audiofile who is very particular about sound ranges and clarity, you'll need to spend a little than this. For the price, these can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Dan G

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound and appearance
customer_reviews.text: After quite a bit of research, I had narrowed my search down to the Pioneer Andrew Jones designed system and these speakers from Energy. The final deciding factor was the compact design. Paired with the Yamaha RX-V479 I also purchased from Amazon, I am well pleased with the sound. Make no mistake... these speakers will not please an audiophile. The sub gives plenty of rumble and voices are clear from the center channel. If I had to choose again, I would do the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Terrific value and more importantly it sounds great for the ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrific value and more importantly it sounds great for the size of the speakers. I paired them with the Marantz NR1403 Receiver and find it a perfect combo for use in a small room. The high gloss finish coordinates nicely with the frame of the TV, which also has a high gloss black finish, and I left the grille covers off to show off the drivers. I originally had a expensive Bose system which became unreliable after many years of service but don't miss it at all after buying this new system.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: The previous ones I've purchased come with wall brackets to make mounting them on the wall slick and easy. Overall I'm very happ
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased now 3 sets of these speakers and have always been very impressed with the build and sound quality. These are a bit different than the others I've purchased in that they don't include wall kits, so if you want to mount them to the wall you have to hang them vertically with a screw. This is a bit of a drawback because you can't angle the speaker downward. The previous ones I've purchased come with wall brackets to make mounting them on the wall slick and easy. Overall I'm very happy with these speakers and highly recommend them for the quality / value you get from Energy.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic bargain!
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a couple months now and am very pleased with the quality of this speaker set. The satellite speakers have a nice high end gloss finish and a heavy feel to them. The bass driver really kicks it out too. I'm running them with a Yamaha RX-V677 and the set really comes alive around 20dB on the amp. Over all they replicate sounds very well to point where my kids look around or jump at sounds behind them. I admit I've been startled by sounds several times as well. Really a fantastic bargain in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: h8monday

customer_reviews.title: Ordered these on basis of good previous reviews and was not disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these on basis of good previous reviews and was not disappointed. These are very compact speakers with good sound quality and are easily assembled in a tight apartment or small office configuration. While not strong on base sound, they are not "tinny" sounding, and reproduce a variety of complex sounds and vocals extremely well for small speakers. If you want good speakers for a small space they are excellent!
customer_reviews.author: D. G. S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - far better than the speakers that came with ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent - far better than the speakers that came with my Yamaha RX-V377 receiver. Incredible warmth, punctuation, depth, tone, etc. The subwoofer rocks!! while living in an apartment complex, I must restrain from playing levels at my full desire. The sound that streams through my xbox 360 games & amazon prime movies app, the samsung blu-ray dvd's, the receiver's radio, the OTA optical tv signal, & computer hdmi is all a very tight, full, & impressive sound - a huge leap from the home theater in a box speakers that I originally had!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: R Peterson

customer_reviews.title: This system would satisfy 95% of the population
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding sound at an exceptional price point. I really feel that you would need to spend double to notice a difference in sound quality. This system would satisfy 95% of the population. The sub meshes perfectly with the other speakers in a way that makes the overall sound output a fabulous experience. Not like some of the other systems that I have owned where it feels like weak, flat, dull, speakers paired with a massive, sloppy, booming bass sub. In this system the speaker all compliment each other perfectly and sound crisp and tight..
customer_reviews.author: Matt S.

customer_reviews.title: The best ~$300 i have ever spent
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing these speakers i was considering buying a set of Bose cause my mom has a set and they sound really good. After reading all the reviews on Amazon and other AV sites i pulled the trigger on the Energy 5.1 instead. Holy Holly, the sub woofer is a beast and luckly has it's own volume control so i won't get complaints from the neighbors. The rest of the speakers are sharp, crisp and responsive. Personally i think it sounds as good as my moms Bose system... only it's ~$700 cheaper. With the Energy 5.1 you can have it all, small speakers, small price and big sound.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Having fun watching movies and playing games and while listening to ...
customer_reviews.text: Loving every bit of it. Can't complaint. The songs which made it to my list sounds new on this. I'm hearing sounds which I never have before. Combined with Onkyo TX-NR636 7.2-Ch Dolby Atmos Ready Network A/V Receiver w/ HDMI 2.0 and you have a powerful sound system right in your living room. A DJ of your own. Subwoofer is out of the world. Having fun watching movies and playing games and while listening to music, I just go in my zone which is hard to achieve unless using headphones. Its really that good.
customer_reviews.author: Megha

customer_reviews.title: Small, but powerful!
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned since I was replacing my large NHT speakers with these, but they do a great job and I have no regrets. I have a pretty large size family room and my NHTs weren't aesthetically pleasing. My wife asked if we could get something smaller. These are great. Especially for the home theater.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mastronardi

customer_reviews.title: Good price.  Excellent sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: These sound great. A nice compromise of size and sound quality. Wife did not want huge speakers and these fit the bill. I had to turn the sub down a bit. Excellent voice out of the center channel. I have a 12 x 18 room and it fills the space nicely.
customer_reviews.author: max corbett

customer_reviews.title: Dynamite comes in small packages
customer_reviews.text: If, like me, you have space issues when it comes to audio equipment, you would be hard pressed to find better. I read, and read, and read before biting the bullet on these speakers, and I'm glad I did. It's very impressive how much sound can come out of such a small set of speakers. Our living room is very open, with large openings to other rooms, so I feared there was no way such small speakers could fill the room. They can. I can't imagine being happier with speakers at twice the price and four times the size.
customer_reviews.author: TheStarsFan

customer_reviews.title: The best bookshelf speakers I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Okay I'm going to make this real easy for everyone. I bought these a year and a half ago... Sound = Friggin AWESOME! Price = The 5 piece set was sold for 300 back then. These are the only speaker set (that I'm aware of anyway) that actually went UP in price. My opinion? Still worth it. I paid 500 dollars for these and a receiver. When my friends come over, they're blown away by the sound and they still think I'm full of crap when I tell them how much I paid. Bottom line? Just get it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A

customer_reviews.title: Small size - big sound
customer_reviews.text: After reading the glowing reviews all over the internet for this little 5.1 system I decided to jump on the bandwagon and get my own set as I was looking for good bang/for the buck small system for my TV and Movie watching. I have not been disappointed as the speakers have handled everything from rumbling bass heavy movies such as Black Hawk Down to the Black Night to lighter fare such as Toy Story with ease (dialogue is clear and sound comes out clean with no distortion even at higher volumes). I currently use the system in a living room that's about 20x17.
customer_reviews.author: JimboJonesNJ

customer_reviews.title: Solid value for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these deliver good quality sound. I think someone looking for speakers in this price range, with a small to moderate sized room, would be happy with these. In a larger space, they may not be as dynamic. I was looking to replace a hodge podge of other speaker components in my living room and found this package reviewed on Cnet. Make no mistake, these won't compete with a >$1000 system, but they do sound good with both movies and music. I have them paired with a Sony STR-DH720 receiver and a Panasonic 42" plasma TV. I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mozilo

customer_reviews.title: Nothing short of perfect.
customer_reviews.text: This set is perfect and exceeded my expectations. Honestly, was debating between this and the Pioneer 5.1 that everyone raves about and I am glad I went with the Energy system. The Pioneer would have been too big, and I get the sound I like out of these. Great surround sound for movies, and great sound for music. Jazz, Rock, Blues, Bluegrass all sound crisp and deep with this set!!! Would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great....buy them
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of research on speakers and kept coming back to these. I never had heard of Energy and was kind of not sure if I wanted to take the chance on them but CNET said they were great for the money...it was a 2009 review but they had add a 2014 update and said they still rock for the money, so I took the chance and I will say.....I am very impressed with these speakers.....love the powered sub-woofer. They work great for my Apartment and I would have to say...they probably could jam pretty loud in a house too. I paired it up with a Denon AVR-1000 Receiver.....I have one Kick A** system folks.....:)
customer_reviews.author: nosferatu_deb

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck and total must buy
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great for the money. After owning these for a while now, I am pleased to say that these are phenomenal speakers for the money. They sound awesome and look great. Some people may not fancy the piano black finish but I think it's classy. I'm no professional audiophile but to my ears the range of sound is amazing. Music that I listen to sounds amazing and the sub isn't over whelming. Everything is just perfect. I recommend this set to all of my friends looking for a basic 5.1 setup and those that bought it have not been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Section 80

customer_reviews.title: Truly Amazing Speakers
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are everything I hoped for. My expectations were very high after doing a ton of research and looking at all the reviews. The Cnet reviews just seemed too good to be true, but for the price I had to give them a shot. I used these speakers with a Sony STR-DN1050 Receiver and even before the 100 hour break in period they sound amazing. They are so clear that it has made me want to watch old movies or play old games again just because the sound is so good it's like watching/playing them for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: MN540

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Competitively priced, timely delivery, packaged well, excellent quality and a great fit.
customer_reviews.author: Sailfish

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound, awesome price
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are awesome. Sound is clear and crisp, and the subwoofer can handle subtle lows in music and make the room rumble in movies. I had tried a couple of sound bars with subwoofers before this, but the Energy Classic is in a whole other league. I can't believe the sound quality for the price. Speakers look nice, with the glossy black piano finish. 5 way binding posts allow for easy and flexible connections. Overall, this is a great set of speakers at an unbelievable price.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive performance. Bought a second set for another room in my house
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a lot of speaker systems in my day and these are, by far, the best I've had. The highs sound crystal clear and the bass is full bodied and warm. The subwoofer is particularly impressive for its range of sound as well as its punch. I don't want big, ugly speakers in my house, but I do want immersive sound. Those two usually don't go together. With the Energy speakers they do. Very impressive.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Speakers
customer_reviews.text: Love these speakers. They fill the room with the sounds of whatever you're watching. They're great for both listening to music and for pairing with at TV entertainment system. I'd buy them again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Milky's Mom

customer_reviews.title: good speakers -- great for the price
customer_reviews.text: The Energy 5.1 Take Classic Home Theater System is well worth the money. It's so good, in fact, that the big box stores near me cannot keep it in stock. I ultimately did not keep the system because my wife did not like having so many speakers around the room so, for the sake of reducing clutter, I returned them. For the record, while the speakers sounded good I do not think they sounded better -- or maybe not even as good -- as my old pair of Bose tower speakers and an Onkyo subwoofer. I bought the Bose 501 series towers off Craigslist, they have to be ten years old, and they sound great!
customer_reviews.author: SRL2000

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set. 1st set is in my livingroom. Liked them so well bought a second set for my theater setup in the basement
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Energy 5.1 Take Classic
customer_reviews.text: I bought these speakers at the recommendation of CNET and I couldn't be happier. They deliver great sound from a small package at a great price. I love the glossy black piano finish on the product. I used 12 AWG wire and that is the limit of how big you can go. Speakers connected to my system through a Sony STR-DN840 receiver (CNET recommendation) and I mounted my back speakers on Energy Take Classic Universal Speaker Stands. You can see my reviews for both the receiver and speaker stands on Amazon as well. Check out CNET description for more detail.
customer_reviews.author: D. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the price, have been using it for almost a year. Get the set-up right and you should be fine. Mine is hooked up to my Harmon Kardon Avr. Pros 1. Too good for the price 2. Woofer is exceptionally great. 3. Volume output is great, mine has always been in the negative volume Cons 1. Surround and center speaker output quality is so terrible and I am looking forward to replacing those. 2. The glossy on these speakers makes it look like a cheap product. In fact I hate the glossy look!
customer_reviews.author: Cee

customer_reviews.title: Energy Take 5 -Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best sound I've heard in a 5.1 system.Subwoofer really thumps and shakes the floor. I like them so much I bought another set on eBay yesterday. Satellite speakers so clean and clear I couldn't believe it. I listen to music also with this system , love em.. It really helps to have a receiver with a manually setable equalizer.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Smith

customer_reviews.title: You know I'm all about that bass.....
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an audiophile and simply wanted quality and AFFORDABLE speakers to use with an entry-level receiver for a home theater system. The sound quality is great, the design is sleek, and whether at quiet or loud volume levels my ears are content. The additional volume and frequency controls on the back of the subwoofer allow me to ensure my apartment neighbors won't go nuts while still allowing music and movies to sound good.
customer_reviews.author: Owski

customer_reviews.title: Great sound! Very happy audiophile newbie :-)
customer_reviews.text: I still need to connect the two rear speakers, but so far I am loving these speakers. I'm using them with a new Yamaha RV-477 receiver. I can attest that these are fingerprint magnets, but otherwise they seem very well built. I'm no audiophile, but I do enjoy great sound and, at least in my opinion, these deliver that well!
customer_reviews.author: Jared T Fowkes

customer_reviews.title: Great little system
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to buy a set of speakers by the independent parts - sattelites, center, sub - but it just wasn't doable at this time and my TV desperately needed some audio help. I'm very happy with the Take Classics. I paired them with my Denon AVR-1912 receiver and they sound amazing. From BRDs to DVDs to my PS3 games the sound is very good. When I turned on the system the other day - one of the Mission Impossible movies was on cable - and my wife freaked when she heard the helicopter. The subwoofer needed a little tweaking to avoid a slight rattle but the system sounds great... especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Energy is #1 - Very Satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: My family and friends are so impressed with the sound that these speakers put out. I did not end up using the sub that came with this set due to the power I was looking for. I ended up replacing the sub with a Klipsch 10" down firing. Sounds great for my 16x 20 family room. More than enough sound power coming through these speakers. The center speaker is great and you can hear dialogue even in the loud action scenes! Love this system!
customer_reviews.author: Chris A.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful punch, tiny footprint
customer_reviews.text: These Energy speakers, (a brand owned by Klipsch) turned out to be the missing piece from my home entertainment center (Denon AVR-1613, Panasonic VIERA TC-P60ST50). My old Onkyo speakers simply weren't cutting it and they took up a significant portion of the room. These speakers fit perfectly under the wall-mounted television and pack quite the punch. In addition to solid surround sound, the bass is unbelievable. Whenever an iPhone vibrates on the TV, my wife looks over at her phone. It's kind of hilarious.
customer_reviews.author: Marcello De Feo

customer_reviews.title: Out performs the competition
customer_reviews.text: Before I bought these, I looked at and listened to a number of similar sized home theater speakers including Bose, Sony, Yamaha and a few others. The Energy 5.1's were far less expensive than the Bose (which were impressive) but in my and my wife's opinion, had better fidelity, presence and punch. They were simply just better speakers giving a true home theater experience when compared to equal size competitive speakers. If you have the space and budget for bigger (high quality) speakers, by all means go for it. But if you need small, unobtrusive speakers to fade into your decor, these will not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen B

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this system!
customer_reviews.text: The overwhelming positive reviews were a major factor in me buying this system. There were no local stores where I could listen to it before I bought one. But this system has not disappointed. It sounds great. I did listen to some other systems in this price range. None of them came close to how good this sounds. I'm especially amazed at the sub woofer and how good it sounds. It's not wimpy at all. You can definitely feel it. We have this in a medium-sized living room. It's perfect. I highly recommend the system to anyone that's looking for a high-quality theater in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great in a small living area.
customer_reviews.text: Works great in our small living room driven by an 80 Watt amp. They will play louder than I want without distortion. I use them primarily for listening to classical music, some jazz, and some surround sound. Far better than what I had been listening to for too many years. Packaging was primo - I was impressed - the glossy finish on every speaker was flawless. Small footprint - big sound.
customer_reviews.author: TA

customer_reviews.title: tremendous value
customer_reviews.text: Impulse purchase. Already had ceiling apart to install recessed lights in the living room and figured id wire for surround while I'm at it. Then Hame of Thrones season premier was a week away and i said screw it. Got these and a Denon receiver. Fantastic value i can definitely say. The sub has really good punch. I was originally going to wire it through the ceiling and behind the couch but it wasn't even necessay. The piano black finish is VERY EASILY SCUFFED though.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Copin

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, small size.
customer_reviews.text: Great speakers. Compact but great sound. In our condo with neighbors around I don't need anything louder. I happily got a noise comment (not really a complaint) the first day I had them and watched an action movie.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Recommend to purchase
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my living room. I'm surprised by the sound quality. Can't beat it for the price you pay. Karaoke sound great with this system
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to go with my new Denon 1912. Both were rated at the top of their class by cnet. The combination blows away my old stereo - a cheaper Sony system. They tell you to give the speakers a 50 hour break in period. So I restrained myself and waited before cranking the sound. The clarity is great all through the volume range of the Denon which I've maxed out, but had to turn down. My set up is in a smaller room - about 12x12, but I'm sure they would sound great in my living room as well. Very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: DVD Addict

customer_reviews.title: Little in size, big in sound.
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe so much sound is coming from these little speakers! I have them connected to a Pioneer 1123 AV switcher and my system rocks. Last night we watched A Capital Fourth on PBS and it felt like we were right there. Due to the low price I was a little reluctant to spring for this speaker system, but the first time I powered them up all doubt was gone. Their shiny black finish matches my Pioneer Kuros plasma display perfectly. Get you some, you will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Willim M. Mcroberts

customer_reviews.title: Energy Home Theater System
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Energy 5.1 Take Classic Home Theater System at the same time as the Marantz SR5005 receiver and speaker stands. The delivery was on time. After getting it all set up and having the receiver run the sound tests, the sound quality was amazing. It does stipulate that there is a break in period so I didn't push the envelope until just the other day. I was curious to see if there was any distortion at full volume for a couple of seconds and there was none. Quite impressive, although I would never run it that loud. I would definitely recommend this system to others.
customer_reviews.author: Schmitty

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and design aesthetic in affordable speakers
customer_reviews.text: These speakers are small and compact. They are a piano black that looks great with most electronics and decor. Speakers have a good construction and sound quality. I was worried the center channel wouldn't have enough sound for voices since it's basically the same as the satellite speakers, but it has sounded great so far. The satellites have great sound for their size. The subwoofer has done pretty well, but I wish it extended to a little lower frequency. This speaker set was a great purchase and have drastically improved the viewing experience of movies and television. I would recommend them to anyone looking for a good, valuable 5.1 surround sound setup.
customer_reviews.author: Aerocowboy

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound
customer_reviews.text: Great sound !!! I'm using it with my old Sony AV receiver which was a part of HTIB package. The amp has limited controls and was not able to produce clear sound with the original Sony speaker set it had. Just replacing those with Energy speakers and Sub has made a huge improvement. Once I get a new AV receiver, it would sure give better results. Happy that I did not put my money on Bose Acoustimass 6 or 10 series speakers - these are way better.
customer_reviews.author: Anirban Datta

customer_reviews.title: Best-sounding speaker system at this price
customer_reviews.text: My speakers are matched with the Onkyo TX-SR608 AV receiver. This is the best-sounding speaker system at this price. The receiver's Audyssey technology provided a good initial setup but the center (dialogue) channel sounded weak until I reset the crossovers at 100 Hz. The powered subwoofer is more than adequate. There was a lot of tweaking to adjust the sound to my liking and I was able to achieve very good sound for dialogue, vocals and instrumentals. There's no distortion at high volumes. Concerts in DTS audio produce very clean and clear sounds in a realistic surround environment. The high gloss black finish is attractive and classy.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful.
customer_reviews.text: Small speaks with a lot of sound. Speakers blend into the surroundings but the sound speaks out. They are solid and well built. The speakers fit stands with no problems. The sub woofer works as expected. I would recommend this system to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent speaker system for the price...we were thinking of buying Bose system and saw this one rated more than Bose in CNET. Glad that we chose this over the Bose, worth for the money and high quality music system
customer_reviews.author: Sasi

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: This speaker system is 100% amazing. We switched from Bose to Energy because of reviews via Home Audio Electronics magazine who rated them as INCREDIBLE. I then looked at reviews on CNET who has this system as their best rated audio system. You can not go wrong with these speakers. They get my highest rating I could ever give for a speaker system...and I'm an audiophile...big time.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Baily

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this speaker package to go with my Denon AVRS500BT-R Receiver. This is my first real surround system and it sounds amazing! The real surround sound is so much better than the "simulated" surround you get from sound bars. Movie and TV watching experiences are completely transformed - I feel like I'm in a real movie theater! The audio quality is awesome - I'm very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Sweet!
customer_reviews.text: Ive had my Take Classics 3 months now. Have them connected to my Onkyo THX 705. Cant believe the sound, richness and bass for such compact speakers. Very classy looking and match up well with any interior. I've seen the price as low as $300. Anyone who passes that price up is crazy if they are in the market for a great compact size surround sound home theatre speaker system. Believe me Ive market tested and compared before buying mine. There are alot of great speakers out there but you'll be hard to find a great sounding system comparable in price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: L. Corona

product_meta.title: Energy 5.1 Take Classic Home Theater System (Set of Six, Black)
product_meta.description:
Style:Home TheatreThis landmark Energy 5.1 Take Classic home entertainment system flaunts superior MDF cabinets finished in sophisticated high-gloss black. It includes a powerful 200-watt subwoofer with a front-firing port, 8" driver and patented Ribbed Elliptical Surround(TM) for well-defined bass reproduction. But the coup de grâce is the newly added Convergent Source Module (CSM) with its 3" poly-titanium woofer and .75" Hyperbolic(TM) aluminum-dome tweeter. This proprietary technology provides a dynamic frequency range and an expansive soundstage, resulting in smooth, realistic sound that emanates from each satellite speaker as well as the center channel. Music and movie lovers can now rejoice because the Take Classic not only breathes life into every entertainment experience, it incites an intense passion in every listener.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
A CNET Editor's Choice winner for February 2009, the Energy 5.1 Take Classic Home Entertainment Speaker System is a no-compromise collection of high-tech components that offer complete and uncompromising fidelity at an affordable price. Made up of four Take satellite speakers, a Take center channel speaker and one 200-watt Take powered subwoofer, each high-gloss black speaker component in this system is masterfully integrated with each other creating a killer sound that is much bigger than it looks and that seamlessly meshes with any flat panel HDTV system. 

 


Dramatic home theater quality beyond its size.
View larger. 
Patented Convergent Source Module 3-inch poly-titanium woofer and .75-inch hyperbolic aluminum-dome tweeter.
View larger. 
Stylish high gloss black finish across all components.
View larger. 
Amazing deep bass from 200-watt subwoofer.
View larger. The Lowdown
Take Classic proves that convenience doesn't have to mean compromise. Sure, you can shop for individual home theater components-but you won't get better performance, or better looks. Integrating the best technologies Energy has to offer, the Take Classic can fill your room with hair-rising effects and theater-like sound: hyperbolic aluminum dome tweeters for screaming highs, Convergent Source Modules for clear, crisp dialogue and music and a Ribbed Elliptical Surround on the subwoofer that makes every explosion a room shaking affair. In addition, integrated keyhole wall-mounts, threaded inserts and rubber bumpers let you choose how and where to place your speakers.

Bragging Rights
Energy has been a leader in audio research and development as well as in the engineering and manufacturing of speakers since 1973. With this pedigree Take Classic components were developed with Energy's core principles in mind. These include:

Flat On-Axis Frequency Response with Wide Bandwidth - Speakers should reproduce the entire audio range in a uniform manner. By ensuring that no one frequency dominates any other, Energy ensures that every note is the way it was intended to be-and the sound as natural as possible.

Wide and Constant Dispersion - Sound at all frequencies radiating from the speaker should be in an even pattern, in all directions throughout the room.

Low Distortion and Resonance - Speaker system is distortion- or resonance-free, but Energy has achieved a significantly lower distortion level, a clearly audible improvement.

The Take Classic 5.1 home theater system also offers terrific performance and great features:

 * Our patented Convergent Source Module (CSM) 3-inch poly-titanium woofer and .75-inch hyperbolic aluminum-dome tweeter -the heart of Energy speakers
 * Patented Ribbed Elliptical Surround woofers create high efficiency, low distortion
 * An aluminum dome tweeter for sonic accuracy
 * Front and rear venting for more powerful bass response

Take Classic raises the bar for 5.1 speaker system performance. It includes a powerful 200-watt subwoofer with a front-firing port, 8-inch driver and Ribbed Elliptical Surround™ for bass that you feel as much as hear. The Convergent Source Module (CSM), with its 3-inch poly-titanium woofer and .75-inch hyperbolic aluminum-dome tweeter, focuses sound for clearer dialogue and stirring music. The CSM gives soundtracks a dynamic frequency range and a huge soundstage, for smooth, realistic sound from each satellite speaker and the center channel. Music and movie lovers rejoice. Take Classic puts the passion back into your favorite films. Exclusive Energy® Brand Technologies

Convergent Source Module
The Convergent Source Module, or CSM, provides wide dispersion, low distortion and amazing midrange performance. The speaker's midrange and tweeter are positioned in close proximity to one another and act as a single source, thereby increasing overall dispersion and reducing any lobing effect. The chambering of the mid and tweeter lowers the driver's resonance, reducing distortion.

Ribbed Elliptical Surround Technology
Energy's patented Ribbed Elliptical Surround technology (U.S. patent #6,725,967, Canadian patent #2,407,123) increases excursion, eliminates distortion and raises efficiency on woofers and subwoofers. The Elliptical Surround encompasses the cone, allowing it to move identically in both directions, resulting in near zero distortion. And while conventional designs are often plagued with surround dimpling, which causes them to radiate in and out of phase and distort at all listening levels, Energy's designs aren't influenced by dimpling at all, instead proprietary Ribbed Elliptical Surround technology allows for a larger cone surface, resulting in greater efficiency. This design also lets the cone achieve greater peak to peak movement, thus allowing it to travel more than double the distance of the competition. These attributes enable Energy woofers and subwoofers to move incredible amounts of air, ultimately allowing them to play lower frequencies with greater bass extension and fidelity.

What's in the Box
A 6-piece, high gloss black set of Energy Take Classic 5.1 speakers: 4-Take satellite speakers, 1-perfectly matched Take center channel speaker, 1-perfectly matched Take powered subwoofer; 1-owners manual.

Technical Specifications

 * Frequency Response - Sat: 115Hz-20KHz; Center: 110Hz-20KHz; Subwoofer: 33Hz-150Hz +/- 3dB
 * Crossover Point - 2.9 kHz
 * Sensitivity - 89dB
 * Power Handling - Sat & Center: 100 Watts; Subwoofer: 200 Watts
 * Recommended Amplifier Power - 20 - 100 Watts RMS (continuous)
 * Impedance - 8-ohm compatible
 * Subwoofer Variable Low Pass Filter - 40Hz-150Hz @ 18dB/octave
 * Tweeter - ¾-inch (19 mm) Hyperbolic™ aluminum-dome
 * Woofer - Sat & Center: 3-inch poly-titanium; Sub: 8" IM Cone with Patented Ribbed Elliptical Surround
 * Dimensions (inches) - Sat: 6 7/8 x 4 1/8 x 4 1/8; Center: 4 1/8 x 10 1/4 x 4 1/8; Subwoofer: 12 5/8 x 12 5/8 x 12 5/8 (add 2 1/6" for feet)
 * Weight - Sat: 2.9 lbs; Center: 3.2 lbs; Subwoofer: 19.7 lbs

Maximum Performance Tips: 
The center channel speaker needs to be centrally located so that the dialogue appears to be coming from the center of the screen. It needs to be above or below the monitor, as closely to it as possible. If you're using a rear projection television, the most likely option is to place it above the screen. If you have a front projection system, you have choices-stand mounting, or placement on furniture, for example. It is important, though, to place the speaker so that its front edge is even with the edge of the shelf or stand supporting it. Unwanted diffraction occurs when the center channel is too far back into a cabinet or other surface with edges that could impede sound dispersion.

For left or right front channels, the distance between the speakers should be 6-8 feet at minimum for the best stereo imaging. The optimum room shape is rectangular, with the speakers along one of the shorter walls, facing the opposite side. If possible, do not place speakers against a wall or at rear of a bookshelf; corner placement is usually the worst option. Try to keep the speakers-especially rear vented models-at least two feet from the surface behind it, unless you use a vent plug. For best results mounting on a rear wall, position the speakers so they flank the main listening area and point toward the front of the room. They should be raised to a height of approximately six feet and should ideally have a space of six feet between them. The three most common subwoofer locations include corners (which can result in boomy or exaggerated low frequency response), placement along a wall, away from the corner (producing moderate bass performance with increased fidelity over corner placement), or beside a front speaker (creating a better blend with the front speaker, but sacrificing overall volume). Experimentation with subwoofer placement is highly encouraged; slight adjustments can create big differences in sound reproduction. To test subwoofer placement, install it temporarily in your main listening position and walk around the listening room while playing a familiar piece of music until you find the best sounding position.



REVIEW FROM HOME THEATER MAGAZINE
REVIEW FROM HOMETHEATERMAG.COM: ENERGY TAKE CLASSIC
It came as no surprise to me that Energy's Take Classic speaker package was such a fine all-around performer. The brand has a strong track record in sat/sub packages, and this set continues the tradition. No, these speakers won't give you the slamming low-frequency effects you'd get from phat towers and/or a giant sub. But they deliver the midrange goods--the single most important aspect of speaker performance, if I had to choose one--and kept me intelligently entertained.

 * Read the full review at hometheatermag.com
